channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Copper's Outlook Pressured by Trump Policies, BMI Says
item.description: Copper was stronger, but its outlook is clouded by expectations of a stronger dollar, looming tariffs and a potential deceleration in the energy trans...

item.title: Billionaire Bill Ackman wants to build a ‘modern-day Berkshire Hathaway’
item.description: Ackman has unveiled his vision to form a new business out of Howard Hughes Holdings “that would acquire controlling interests in operating companies.”

item.title: CEO of Los Angeles-based home builder says rebuilding will take a long time

item.title: U.S. Sanctions on Russian LNG Could Pose Risks to Europe
item.description: U.S. sanctions against the operators of two Russian liquefied-natural-gas terminals will have a limited impact on global prices but pose supply risks ...

item.title: The stock market’s ‘Trump bump’ will be back. Just be patient.
item.description: The stock market’s rough 2025 start should smooth out after the presidential inauguration.

item.title: Oil prices pull back after hitting 4-month highs on Russia sanctions
item.description: Oil futures pulled back Tuesday, giving back some ground after a three-day rally boosted by a new round of U.S. sanctions on Russia’s oil industry lif...

item.title: Planet Fitness Is Keeping Its Resolutions
item.description: The gym chain’s revamp has taken hold after a franchisee revolt.

item.title: Large-cap U.S. stocks may not be worth buying for a decade, this contrarian says
item.description: Contrarian investor Steven Jon Kaplan says he won’t be buying large-cap U.S. stocks for a decade possibly, as he sees bubble signs everywhere.

item.title: This Year Could Be Tales of Two Stories for U.S. Dollar

item.title: Macquarie to Invest Up to $5 Billion in Applied Digital AI Data Centers
item.description: The deal follows strong investor interest in businesses connected to the AI boom.
